item.title: The Importance of Collaboration
item.description:
In the first in the Redbubble Talks series, four industry leaders discuss the importance of collaboration.
Competition in the art world is tight these days, and success can seem as elusive as Big Foot, or democracy in North Korea. Redbubble is dedicated to supporting Aussie artists as they endeavour to put their creations into the hands of art lovers across the globe. To help Melbourne artists do their thing, Redbubble is putting four of the industry’s top leaders in front of 80 lucky creators to talk about one thing: collaboration.
Collaboration is becoming a key ingredient to success in this competitive industry, so Redbubble is excited to bring you some words of wisdom from photographer David Russell, tattooist Jack Douglas, curator and consultant Kifka Kingan and illustrator Loretta Lizzio.
Limited to 80 people.
Arrive at 3.30pm for a 4pm start.

item.title: The Human Walking Program
item.description:
After gaining worldwide attention following the first Human Walking Program earlier this year, The Lost Dogs’ Home and their shelter dogs are back to rescue desk-bound office workers once again.
Encouraging office workers to break the shackles of sedentary work and enjoy the simple pleasure of letting a dog take them for a walk, this unique event is set to take place at Melbourne's Treasury Gardens.
‘By taking the dogs out of the shelter and into the inviting surrounds of a park, we are giving more humans the opportunity to meet and interact with a shelter dog – and in doing so showing them what worthy and wonderful companions they make. Taking a dog for a walk or just enjoying their company, are proven stress relievers. So we are thrilled to offer city workers a much needed therapeutic break from the office,’ said the Lost Dogs’ Home’s Kate Hoelter.
Lost Dogs’ Home ambassador and Human Walking Program MC Mike Larkan is also encouraging office-bound city workers to escape and join him in the fresh air at lunch-time, to let a dog take them for a walk.
The first event captivated dog lovers and animal shelters worldwide, reaching an estimated 2,230,498 Australians; while there were a total of over a million views of the video after being shared by Upworthy.
There will be big dogs, little dogs and everything in between just waiting to take poor office workers out for a walk, or have a quick, playful pat before they head back to the office. There is bound to be a dog to suit every human.

item.title: Il Giallo Durante il Fascismo
item.description:
The Istituto Italiano di Cultura in association with the Australasian Centre for Italian Studies (ACIS) and La Trobe University presents 'Il "giallo" durante il Fascismo: le serie di Carlo Lucarelli e Maurizio de Giovanni' – a talk in Italian by Dr Barbara Pezzotti, Honorary Research Fellow of ACIS.
Dr Pezzotti will talk about two popular crime series set during the Fascist dictatorship in Italy. The first, by Carlo Lucarelli, features Inspector De Luca who investigates crimes during the Republic of Salo and after World War II, while the second, by Maurizio de Giovanni, showcases Inspector Luigi Alfredo Ricciardi, who uses his 'superpowers' to solve crimes in Naples in the 1930s.
Please note the talk will be in Italian. Light refreshments will be served.
Dr Barbara Pezzotti and Dr Brigid Maher from La Trobe University are organising a one-day symposium dedicated to Italian crime writing entitled 'Why Crime Fiction Matters: The Italian Case', to be held on Friday 21 November at the La Trobe University City Campus, 215 Franklin Street, Melbourne.

item.title: Sheep Dog Demonstration
item.description:
Come to Creswick Woollen Mills in Railway Parade in Creswick to see sheep dog demonstrations with Merylin Wallis. Merylin was born in Hamilton and has been dog training for 30 years. You will gain insightful information on how to start to train sheep dogs, responsible breeding and demonstrations with dogs and sheep. This will include, shedding and splitting some sheep off from the herd, driving and heading. It is fascinating to watch how Merilyn and these highly intelligent dogs interact with the sheep.
Great entertainment for the family and opportunity to visit the last coloured spinning mill in Australia. Come and visit the Very Fine Yarn centre, the finalist for the 'New Tourism Development' in RACV 2014 Victorian Tourism Awards

item.title: Tech Savvy Seniors at Orbust Library
item.description:
The Orbust Library will be holding some free technology training Tech Savvy Seniors.
This program has been developed to assist older people who have had limited or no previous experience in using technology to learn new skills for the future.
This free training will help older people to access information and stay connected with their family, friends and communities.
Bookings are essential as spaces are limited.

item.title: Tech Savvy Seniors at Lakes Entrance Library
item.description:
The Lakes Entrance Library will be holding some free technology training Tech Savvy Seniors.
This program has been developed to assist older people who have had limited or no previous experience in using technology to learn new skills for the future.
This free training will help older people to access information and stay connected with their family, friends and communities.
Bookings are essential as spaces are limited.

item.title: Pamela Irving Open Studio
item.description:
Pamela Irving's work graces some of Melbourne's public spaces such as Larry Latrobe, the bronze dog in the City Square, her mosaic reverie on the Luna Palace Building, Luna Park, Melbourne and the mosaic underpass at Patterson Station.
Doggerel Dreams is her latest body of works which you can now view at her Patterson Rd, Bentleigh Studio. She will hold two open days. Her exhibition continues until Christmas please contact operator for opening times. You are welcome to browse.

item.title: Official Opening of the NICTA RMIT Data Analytics Lab
item.description:
The new NICTA RMIT Data Analytics Lab will create a hub for applied data analytics projects based around RMIT and NICTA's strong expertise in this area. Data analytics offers huge potential to transform the efficiency and productivity of a range of industries, such as transport, manufacturing, mining and the finance sector.
Come to the launch of this dynamic new hub and see how data analytics is deployed to meet Victorian businesses' needs and meet some of the world-class experts at the newest site of Australia's ICT Research Centre of Excellence.
Light refreshments will be served.
Source: City of Melbourne What's On

item.title: O! Paper Pop Up!
item.description: O! Paper create original greeting cards and printed goods to make special moments extra special. Experience the full O! Paper collection of Christmas cards, greeting cards, and stationery at The O! Paper pop up shop. Plus original artworks by Emi Ueoka, contributing artist to The New Yorker, New York Times, The Plant Journal and Nieves books.

item.title: Melbourne Music Week – Little Bands at Signal
item.description:
Pay homage to Melbourne's unique Little Bands scene with a lively, insightful panel discussion followed by cracking sets from the next wave of Little Bands.
Flashback to Melbourne in the late 1970s when Little Bands were flourishing and key members of the vibrant underground scene were coming together to create one-off supergroups focused on artistic expression and risk-taking. Characterised by large numbers of short-lived bands, more concerned with artistic expression than mainstream success, the scene was a turbulent melting pot of people, names and sounds.
Panel special guests include Stuart Grant, figurehead of the Little Bands scene and member of Primitive Calculators; Jimi Kritzler, the author of Noise In My Head: Voices from the Ugly Australian Underground; Kate Reid, founder of the independent record label It Records.
Join them as they discuss the rich history of Melbourne's underground music scene and explore shared experiences, inspiration and the challenges associated with being a part of such a spirited, close-knit community.
Following the discussion, celebrate the scene and witness Melbourne’s finest emerging artists manifest a new generation of Little Bands with collaborations from members of Bum Creek, Superstar, White Hex/Slug Guts, Witch Hats/Melbourne Cans, Batrider, Whitehorse, Pets with Pets, School of Radiant Living, Batpiss and more.
Food and coffee trucks will be onsite to keep everyone fed and watered.
Source: City of Melbourne What's On

item.title: Dank: Spectres of Lignite
item.description:
Dank: Spectres of Lignite is inspired by the strange aesthetic of the photographer's home in the Latrobe Valley, the centre of the brown coal power industry in Victoria. The natural valley landscape is marred by the monumental industrial forms of power stations shrouded in clouds of mist – at once magnificent, menacing and surreal. Since power generation was privatised in the 1990s, the area has existed under a systemic cloud of socio-economic problems, and a pervading sense of unease and anxiety exacerbated by the recent Hazelwood coalmine fire.
Built in 1922, the hulking form of the Yallourn Production Centre administrative building now stands derelict and empty. Simultaneously beautiful and ugly, it exists as the last remnant of an earlier period of optimism and industrialisation. Overshadowed by the monolithic chimneys of the newer power plant nearby, after a short-lived reincarnation as a nightclub (and rumoured brothel), it now stands like an oversized headstone memorialising an era of growth and decay.
Source: City of Melbourne What's On

item.title: Adnan Baraké Syrian Orpheus Album Launch
item.description:
Syrian composer and oud-player Adnan Baraké launches his second album at Fortyfivedownstairs. The album, Syrian Orpheus features original works from the oud and draws on Middle-Eastern and Western traditions.
Strongly influenced by traditional Arabic music, Adnan explores country, bluegrass and classical styles to create contemporary sounds on this ancient instrument.
Adnan's musical virtuosity has received world attention and is proudly supported by the City of Melbourne.

item.title: Chiltern Mo Ride
item.description:
Chiltern Mo Ride 2014 is designed to raise awareness about men's health in small Australian communities.
The event is held to raise awareness and funds for the Movember Foundation whilst supporting the awareness of men's health issues including prostate cancer, testicular cancer and depression in men.
You can grow a Mo and/or enter one of the many Chiltern Mo Ride events, there is something for everyone and you can help raise funds for this great cause.
Over $30,000 has been raised over the past 2 years at this event come along to raise more funds while having a great time.
Register on the day to join the Chiltern MoRide 2014 or you can register on line at www.chilternvic.com
You can also join the Chiltern Mo Ride team as a Mo Bro or Mo Sista on the Movember website.

item.title: Twilight Market at Brunswick East Primary School
item.description:
Wind down on your Friday afternoon and into the evening at Brunswick East Primary School's annual Twilight Market.
Enjoy great food and drinks whilst soaking up the atmosphere and enjoying fabulous entertainment on the main stage! Enjoy a summer cocktail, coffee by Padre, sample gourmet delights from BEPS chefs and CERES.
A fantastic range of gifts and treats available, including quality crafts, cakes and more, all made with love by the BEPS Makers and Bakers. Lucky dips, auction and raffle - all with great prizes!
Kids cafe, garden tours, activities, second-hand books and toys all available. Fun rides for the kids - chair-o-plane, jumping castle, giant slide, as well as LEGO play sessions, silent disco and the 'Brunswick-famous' Sideshow alley. Free entry. Event starts at 3:30 pm and finishes at 8:00 pm.
Held in the grounds of the Brunswick East Primary School and easily accessed by public transport.

item.title: Ballarat Pop-Up Shop
item.description:
Opening the holiday gift-buying season, Pop-Up Co. brings you, for the third year, the Ballarat Pop-Up Shop - an exclusive retail shopping event featuring quality goods from some of our region's best designers and makers.
The Ballarat Pop-Up Shop is an annual Christmas event. Find that perfect gift for someone special!
Open only six days over two weekends - Friday 10am-9pm, Saturday & Sunday 10am-4pm.

item.title: Unravelling the Mysteries of Human Consciousness
item.description:
What is it to be aware? What makes people conscious? The complexities of consciousness have intrigued philosophers and scientists for thousands of years, but can modern neuroscience ever hope to understand this phenomenon?
From philosophers and ethicists to neuroscientists, this panel of experts, including Baroness Professor Susan Greenfield, will discuss the topic of consciousness.

item.title: Libraries and Learning: Borrowing from Digital?
item.description:
Come to a Melbourne Conversations at the Dock on the changing nature of libraries in the digital age.
The growth of mobile and informal learning has meant that libraries and community spaces are changing and stepping up. Through new approaches to learning and creative digital technology, libraries are cultivating and employing 'digital literacy', imperative for lifelong learning, work and civic belonging.
Famous educator, ICT expert and advocate of fun and games, Professor Stephen Heppell will join with local creative technologist Brad Hammond and City Of Melbourne Library Services Manager Paula Kelly, to discuss what learning and libraries look like today and what they might look like tomorrow. (P.S. They still have books!)
Panellists: - Professor Stephen Heppell, educator, academic and CEO of Heppell.net, UK - Brad Hammond, Creative Technologist and Director of Ethno Tekh, Melbourne - Paula Kelly, Library Services Manager, City of Melbourne - MC Peter Mares - writer, journalist, researcher and academic.
Brad Hammond is the City of Melbourne's Inaugural Knowledge Fellow supported by the Copyright Agency Limited Cultural Fund and ISS Institute. Professor Heppell is supported by the ISS Institute as an international visiting fellow.

item.title: Hexasonic
item.description:
A sonic feast for the senses, Hexasonic brings together artists of the Ableton Live User Group Melbourne and their unique styles for a united sound experiment.
With each act bringing a 20 to 30-minute set of their own audio flavour to the table, styles range from ambient and electro-acoustic to EDM and IDM. There’ll be live looping, real-time FX processing and live remixing of original and improvised electronica.
Step into the Hexadome – Arts Centre Melbourne's new pop-up space – live and undercover on the Theatres Forecourt for two nights only.
Ableton Live User Group Melbourne is a broad community of both professional and amateur music producers who are drawn together with the intention of sharing musical and production ideas.
The group welcomes all attendees, no matter what level of experience they have with Ableton Live, and offers a chance to meet with other producers, share knowledge, get feedback and hang out with other like-minded enthusiasts.
Free sessions are held each month at Arts Centre Melbourne, in which both guest speakers and group members are encouraged to get up and show their latest work, production techniques and live sets.
Source: City of Melbourne What's On

item.title: Grassroots Market
item.description:
The very successful Grassroots Market is being held in Main Street in Upwey this November.
The market will feature 85 stalls selling local artisan products. The Grassroots Market can help you with your Christmas shopping with clothes, shoes, handbags, crafts, art, ceramics, glass, jewellery and more.
There will be food and entertainment to sustain you as you shop.

item.title: Mos & Mobiles: Growing & Cultivating Mobile Customer Engagement
item.description:
With mobile use higher than ever MitchelLake has partnered with Movember and pulled together some of the leaders across mobile to learn from their approaches using mobile technology in order to drive customer acquisition and engagement.
They would love for you to join them for this educational, interactive and inspirational event as you hear from an exciting panel of storytellers including David Smith, Movember Foundation; James Noble, Carter Digital: & Mark Oliver, Tigerspike with a final speaker to be announced shortly.
This will be a unique opportunity to hear not only the successes but the challenges that have pushed the speakers to be leaders in their field. They look forward to seeing you there.
This is a free event so spread it far and wide. Event runs from 6.30 to 8pm.

image.altText: Mos & Mobiles: Growing & Cultivating Mobile Customer Engagement
Mos & Mobiles: Growing & Cultivating Mobile Customer Engagement

item.title: Fluid Festival at York on Lilydale
item.description:
Fluid Festival at the York on Lilydale will showcase some of the Australia's best beers, ciders and wines. The event will feature stalls from over 15 local and international suppliers, offering the chance to sample a huge range of flavours and styles.
In addition to tastings, you will have the opportunity to meet some of the best in the business at the Meet the Brewer master classes.
Kicking off at 11 am, finishing about 4.30 pm, the event is free to attend all day. Stands will be set up outside at the rear of the hotel near the Lake. Great food will also be available, ranging from Bavarian sausages to Hot Roast Beef Rolls off the Spit.
There will be plenty of entertainment on the day catering for families including an inflatable maze, inflatable castle, miniature animal farm, face painting, and much more.
Also there will be a stage set up featuring Bedrock with Lead Singer none other than Lee Harding from Australian Idol and Secret Empire.
To pre-purchase taste tokens and save money head to their website. Taste tickets available on day.
The York on Lilydale is one of the popular hotels in the Yarra Ranges, offering accommodation, dining, entertainment and conference facilities, and is located about 40 minutes from the city at the foot of Mt Dandenong.

item.title: How to get 20 clients in 20 hours
item.description:
Are you tired of working really hard but not getting the clients you deserve?
Would you like to get clients more quickly and easily?
Imagine getting new clients right away! Or starting a new business from scratch and being successful quickly. At "How to get 20 clients in 20 hours", you will finally start to see how you can get clients consistently to create an ongoing stream of income. You will be blown away by how simple it is for you to get more clients through the door.
Here is what you will learn in this information-packed day:
Part 1: Setting the foundations so you can build a strong business. Part 2: Attracting your ideal clients and making great sales. Part 3: Putting it all together for quick results. As well as bonus resources and other secrets will be shared on the day.
Too busy to attend? Then maybe you should be attending! If you are too busy that means you could be much more effective.
At the event you will have a single day to focus solely on your business and how to improve it. You will also have fantastic network opportunities with other successful small business owners and entrepreneurs.
Don't put it off. Show your business a little love. Learn how to get 20 clients in 20 hours now!

item.title: New World Dreaming
item.description:
Melbourne is built on the footprints of immigrants, most of whom came through the port and docklands.
In the 1850s Andrew's Irish great-great-grandparents fled the blighted potato fields of Donegal and reached Melbourne, via India in rebellion. They arrived in Melbourne in summer, to a welcome of bushfires, wild dogs and news of the Great Melbourne Telescope gazing at the heavens.
Peter's in-laws left Calabria in the 1950s, where the war had destroyed the established order in their village. Women did men's work and men, especially the ones who had been prisoners of war, had glimpsed other ways of life. When the old order began to reassert itself those who expected more of life had to look elsewhere. Peter's in-laws headed for Melbourne.
Andrew and Peter are seasoned storytellers and in this intimate production they use music and spoken word to give expression to the lives of a few of the millions fleeing the stagnation and turmoil of old worlds to make a life for themselves in a new one.

item.title: Barriers to Education
item.description:
Explore an interactive installation that uncovers the world's greatest challenges to education, in the Swanston St Forecourt of Federation Square.
Barriers to Education is a school-based initiative of Save the Children Australia. The program focuses on education as a fundamental right of all children and highlights the key barriers to learning for children around the world.

item.title: Risky Business- Managing Risk at your events
item.description:
The City of Port Phillip is hosting Risky Business, a free information session. The seminar is aimed at anyone organising an event whether it be big or small event; community event, school fair, sporting or local trader event.
By attending the event seminar you will discover the importance of risk management. Key discussion will include: what is risk, identifying risk, understanding implementing and developing a risk plan, writing an emergency response plan and managing risk in this changing landscape.
This event is free and will be held on Wednesday 19 November at Council Chambers St Kilda Town Hall from 5.30pm to 7.30pm.

address.address1: Corner Carlisle Street and Brighton Road St Kilda

image.altText: Risky Business- Managing Risk at your events
Risky Business- Managing Risk at your events

item.title: Small Business & Party Plan Showcase
item.description:
This event is the newest market located in Taylors Lakes, and supports the local small business owners and party plan representatives, both locally and through Melbourne and Surrounds
Stalls Include, Personalized Products, Jewellery, Children's Clothing & Décor, Women's Accessories, Handmade Arts and Crafts, Home Wares and Home Décor, Beauty and Skincare Products, Perfume, Candles & Soaps, Kids party Ideas and Loads More.
And For the Kids there will be a jumping castle, face painting & arts and crafts

item.title: Clifton Hill Primary School Fair
item.description:
The focus is firmly on a great day out for the whole community at Clifton Hill Primary School's annual fundraising Fair.
With carnival games, rides and live entertainment including local covers band Bin Night Romeos, face painting, photo booth, a wine raffle and a huge silent auction (get the Christmas shopping done in one afternoon) it's the most fun you can have at school.
It's no surprise the Clifton Hill Primary School Fair is famous for its gourmet food, being located only minutes from the Fitzroy and Collingwood foodie hubs the gourmet grub on offer reflects the quality and choice of food in the local area.
This year, among others, there is Le Grand BBQ, baked potatoes and fresh pies, Asian delights and an Italian feast. For sweet lovers there's Italian hand made gelato, Dutch pancakes, Norwegian waffles, the classic scones with fresh strawberries and cream, plus homemade cakes.
Wash it all down with something from the coffee cart, the Little Creatures bar or maybe the dedicated daiquiri stand! And of course, it wouldn't be a fair without lollies, popcorn and fairy floss.
Pick up a bargain at Trash and Treasure, browse the plants and craft stalls, stock up on preserves and Christmas cakes while the children enjoy the Gymbus, giant super slide, Jurassic adventure jumping castle, chuggy choo choo adventure train inflatable, chair-o-plane, bungee challenge, farm animals and much more!
The Clifton Hill Primary School Fair is organised and run by parent volunteers with the support of local businesses. For the last three years, all funds raised were used to build and resource a dedicated science lab.
Entry is free, with various prices for rides and games. The Fair starts at 10am, rain or shine, and will run until 4pm.

item.title: Ding Dong Lounge presents
item.description:
Nestled in the heart of Chinatown, Ding Dong Lounge, one of Melbourne's most iconic alternative music venues, present a stellar line-up for Live Music Safari.
A strong east coast trifecta, the event features Sydney folk/soul artist Ngaiire, Melbourne's very own Jakubi and a special guest opener from Brisbane.
Sydney singer/songwriter Ngaiire is building a name for herself as one of the country's most dynamic vocalists and performers. Captivating audiences with her soulful voice and powerful music, Ngaiire is changing the face of Australian folk/soul music. With an Australian Music Prize nomination, a spot at Soulfest, a string of UK shows and a Glastonbury performance under her belt, 2014 is shaping up to be a big year for the artist.
After releasing their first three singles online, in little over four months Melbourne's Jakubi reached one million plays via YouTube and SoundCloud. After this astounding achievement, the hip-hop/pop collective have sold out venues across Australia (including at Ding Dong Lounge) and are set to work on a collaboration with Mike Posner, who is responsible for writing songs for Justin Bieber, Pharrell Williams, Nelly and Snoop Dogg, in the States.

item.title: The Mercat presents
item.description:
A brood of local beat makers and DJs create a bounty of electronic, sonic wonderment deep in the sweaty dance haven that is The Mercat basement.
Recently named one of Melbourne's 'best kept secrets' by Tone Deaf, four piece Rat & Co open hearts with alluring beats born from wide-eyed looks at hard and industrial city environments. On the back of the release of their second album Binary and second single 'Samurai', an ode to Japanese hip-hop producer Nujabes, Rat & Co play live with exceptional company.
Expect enigmatic sets from the crew behind Animals Dancing with resident DJs Otologic, Tornado Wallace and Andee Frost taking turns. Cult figures of Melbourne's underground, well-versed in throwing parties in the depths of The Mercat basement, this collective drop everything from acid house to disco and mash a multitude of trans-atlantic sounds.
Get lost in the haze of smoke machines and take home a limited edition 7 inch, pressed especially, featuring tracks from the night's acts.

item.title: The John Curtin Hotel presents
item.description:
The John Curtin Hotel presents a night of disco discovery through the windows of time.
Opening in shimmering spectacle, the Sugar Fed Leopards are three female singers, accompanied by spangling guitars and a solid rhythm section, who are sure to conjure Ike-and-Tina magic with their soul-twisted disco originals.
Next up is a nine-piece explosion of yacht-rock, RnB and synth-funk. Cult favourites Sex On Toast break out vocal harmonies, talk-box synthesizers, drum machines and choreographed dance moves.
Finally, Vaudeville Smash catapult the night into disco bliss by sweeping crowds into a 1980s montage that inspires conga lines for roller limbo and the application of copious amounts of glitter.

item.title: The Public Bar presents
item.description:
Back for more in 2014, The Public Bar, North Melbourne's finest dive bar, throws its doors open for another aural expedition of Melbourne acts for Live Music Safari.
Gold Nights, produced by Alex Akers of Forces and released on It Records, has been recognised internationally. White Hex is all 1980s synth, surf guitar and doom vocals set against the cold backlash of a drum machine. The stellar line-up also features local trio Pearls with their sweet melodies, wandering fuzzy guitar lines and hypnotic drums.
Fellow It (Records) kids Little Desert make music with a 1980s post-punk sensibility. Their duelling female vocals and guitar deliver the night's melancholic finale.
Live recordings of the night's performances will be made available free for download.

item.title: 20,000 Days on Earth
item.description:
Before they officially open for the season, Melbourne's favourite summertime cinema warm up the surround sound system with a three-day series of music films especially programmed for MMW.
20,000 Days on Earth which premiered at Sundance to much acclaim. A documentary-not-documentary about the life and times of Australia's dark poet laureate, Nick Cave, it integrates archive and concert footage with re-enactment and staged scenes that may not represent the truth, as it exactly happened, but does represent the truth as it's lived and remembered.
Set over a single day, and directed by visual artists Iain Forsyth and Jane Pollard, it is a smouldering, evocative dive into Cave's myth and his thoughtful, self-aware reflections on the creative process. It is not surprising that Cave has chosen such an innovative way to explore his legacy considering his history with and in some amazing films - from playing a deranged prisoner in Ghosts of the Civil Dead to writing The Proposition, both directed by John Hillcoat.
Track 24 hours with Cave, and a few with Kylie Minogue, that didn't necessarily happen but, nonetheless, elevate the music documentary into warped biopic territory. Then go home and put The Birthday Party on the stereo.

item.title: The Kelvin Club Presents
item.description:
The organisers behind St. Jerome's Laneway Festival deliver their first official Melbourne Music Week event at The Kelvin Club.
This showcase features some of Melbourne's top emerging artists including Japanese Wallpaper, LUCIANBLOMKAMP and Klo.
Staying true to Laneway's objective of hosting forward-thinking artists in unique locations, the historic inner-city venue The Kelvin Club makes for the perfect match.

item.title: The Toff in Town Presents
item.description:
Big local sounds - bellowing vocals and gaining pop by frantic bleeps and turns - take over The Toff in Town for Live Music Safari.
Electronic RnB/soul group The Harpoons are renowned for packing dancefloors, while hyperactive beat-makers Parking Lot Experiments elevate with a whirlwind of hedonistic fun and mayhem.

item.title: Cherry Bar Presents
item.description:
Melbourne's iconic Cherry Bar is religiously rock and roll, but their Soul Thursdays remain one of Melbourne's longest running soul/funk residencies. For Live Music Safari, Cherry Bar shines the spotlight on three emerging local acts from the vibrant soul scene - The Harlots, Stella Angelico and Kingston Crown.
Bluesy rock outfit and triple j Unearthed actThe Harlots have been playing sell-out shows since launching their acclaimed double EP, Coarse Tunes - Parts 1 and 2, and following this year's release, 'Somewhere To Go'.
Stella Angelico have described their style as akin to a soul/rock-meets-disco/Bond soundtrack. Expect big vocals and some serious bass swing to get the dancefloor pumping.
Kingston Crown, a band born from of a shared love of soul and RnB and another triple j Unearthed success story, finish the night's fiery line-up.

item.title: Bennetts Lane Jazz Club presents
item.description:
Bennetts Lane Jazz Club present two rooms of exhilarating live jazz for Live Music Safari.
Swing is the Thing, featuring music from Kelsey James and The Furbelows and dance by Studio 1929, celebrates rollicking 1920s and 30s swing, jive and Lindy Hop. Enter this room and be immersed in the heyday of toe-tapping jazz via the Mills Brothers, Andrews Sisters and Boswell Sisters.
On their resident stage, the Bennetts Lane Big Band astound with the vitality of their contemporary, original big band sounds. Drawing from the very best and innovative talent in Melbourne today, the band features Joseph O'Connor, James Macaulay, Tom Noonan, Kieran Hensey, Jason McMahon, Jon Hunt, Ben Harrison, Callum G'Froerer, Nick Pietsch, Matt McGeachin, Marty Holoubek and James McLean.
Delight in this wonderful spectacle of jazz music and dance, and spend an evening discovering this exuberant and revolutionary art form.

item.title: Live Music Safari launch: Kingswood
item.description:
Indie rock band Kingswood launch this year's Live Music Safari with a special performance at the flagship venue of Melbourne Music Week, Queen Victoria Market.
Kingswood's debut album, produced by Vance Powell (Jack White, Arctic Monkeys and Kings of Leon) in Nashville USA, was released earlier this year and stormed straight to number 6 on the ARIA charts.
Kingswood members are also avid motorbike lovers. In this spirit, Harley-Davidson Street 500 have built The Shed, a temporary motorbike inspired hangout and celebration of creative culture, at Queen Victoria Market for Melbourne Music Week.
Fans can get their hands on the limited number of tickets available for this exclusive opening party through various competitions and promotions in the weeks leading up to the event.

item.title: The Telepathy Project + Sophia Brous
item.description:
Delve into the unconscious spaces of Melbourne's shared gardens, architecture and imagination with this mind-wandering sonic experience.
As part of MPavilion's One Night Stand series of interventions, The Telepathy Project (Veronica Kent and Sean Peoples) invite special guests including hypnotic chanteuse Sophia Brous, following on from her participation in The Barbican Centre's In Dreams: David Lynch Revisited, to come together and celebrate all things celestial for this series of nocturnal and dawn adventures
The resultant recordings of the night's adventures will become a free, sonic experience throughout the week in MPavilion.
This project has been funded as part of the VCA and MCM New Initiatives program, supported by the State Government through Arts Victoria.

item.title: Section 8 and Ferdydurke present
item.description:
Section 8 and Ferdydurke are building a solid reputation for luring crowds with a new era of laneway parties. The two venues pool their highly-tuned party sensibilities to present ZOO, a sensory overload and audio-visual extravaganza for Live Music Safari in Tattersalls Lane.
The iconic laneway closes for a barrage of performance - banging drums, clashing guitars and masterful beats; performance art; improvised approaches to staging and lighting; and a giant, four-storey-high projection wall.
The Zoo line-up includes Brawther, City Calm Down and Paces.

item.title: The Hi-Fi presents
item.description:
The Hi-Fi is proud to present A Basement Show, a nod to the up-and-comers - Magic America, The Good Morrows, Bad Family, Where's Joss and more.
Magic America are the psych rock quartet generating hype and following after the recent release of their single 'I thought I told you'. In the words of Tone Deaf, 'Magic America blend Brit-pop hooks with psyched out rock n roll vibes; they are the local band for fans of The Dandy Warhols, Oasis, and Primal Scream.'
Get set for a wild live set from the Melbourne power-pop-rock outfit The Good Morrows who are duly enjoying praise on the back of their recent single 'Running Around'.
Melbourne's Bad Family are back at The Hi Fi after a phenomenal last minute show in 2013 and Where's Joss, who have spent the year gigging and supporting large shows, complete the stellar line-up.
Toast some of Melbourne's great emerging bands at this energetic Live Music Safari event.

item.title: The Liberty Social presents
item.description:
Requiem present an evening of gothic subcultures at Melbourne dive bar, The Liberty Social.
The city's own bat cave will see Adelaide's Rule of Thirds play songs from their highly-anticipated, long-play debut - a soundtrack to our sparse and mysterious red country. This sextet's wailing female vocals over lashings of guitar, reverberant synth and militant bass and drums is a fresh take on 1970s and 80s Australian gothic rock.
Supports include local purveyors of wave in Repairs, Lakes with their pummelling tribal-rhythms and young upstarts Habits, while trad-goth DJs and members of NUN program sound all evening.
Throughout the night contemporary dance performance artist Agent Cleave leads a troupe of gothicka.
Be swept up in death rock, industrial, gothic and dark wave.

item.title: 1000 £ Bend Presents
item.description:
Roll on in to Live Music Safari as Foreign Brothers transform 1000 £ Bend into a roller disco of cosmic proportions and Northside Records present a full line-up of their signature sounds, from hip-hop to soul and reggae through to funk.
Mondo Freaks, the 1980s funk/post-disco crew, bring their layers of synth and extended breaks to the rink and Triple R presenter Chris Gill plugs local winners to keep people rolling with steeze.
PBS's DJ Manchild plays his colourful mix of Bollywood funk, fiery Columbian-salsa and hip-hop and stepping up the calypso, fellow locals Ms Butt and Lewis Cancut serve up their blend of world beats, percussive house and tropical disco.
Holding the philosophy of past Foreign Brothers events, The Roller Jam is intended to bring together people of diverse backgrounds under the banner of peace, love, unity and fun.
Skates are available for hire; fluoro lycra, sweat band sets and glitter are optional. Get ready to roll.

item.title: Soul Safari + The Perfections + Mayfield
item.description:
Embark on an intimate and rousing, genre-spanning journey as Melbourne's best soul bands warm the city for this special edition of Fed Square Live, the weekly summer music series hosted by Fed Square.
Melbourne's Soul Safari have been making waves across Australia. These groove-based music makers wow crowds with their passionate and energetic performances and leave audiences begging for an encore. Blending neo soul, funk, RnB and hip-hop, this is a band with a story to tell.
Next up are The Perfections and their mix of dirty and sweet garage soul. Describing themselves as 'the lovechild of Otis Redding and The Stooges', lead singer Christina sets the stage alight with her commanding vocals and glitter-tastic antics.
The trio of soulful performances rounds out with Mayfield, a vibrant and solid five piece funk/soul crew, playing deep, rich originals. With a raw and honest sound that manages to be fun and electrifying at the same time, Mayfield are guaranteed to get punters up and dancing.

item.title: Lounge Presents
item.description:
Lounge, one of Melbourne's much-loved music venues, joins the dots between emerging and established artists to showcase our city's highly-revered electronic music labels on two stages and with a laneway party for Live Music Safari.
Sleep D comprises Corey Kikos and Maryos Syawish. Part of the delectable Butter Sessions fleet, this artistic duo have spent the best part of their youth exploring sonic soundscapes and ways to share them with other people.
Harvey Sutherland creates warm floating textures of bass and noodling keys with nods to early techno and the 909 drum machine. He is joined by PhD student Tom Day, who first started making music as a means to escape. Day creates lush, cinematic, piano-based pieces layered with electronic hooks.
Cale Sexton, a hardcore punk kid from way back, is up next. Sexton's switch to electronic music happened recently, but in just a short time he has managed to turn heads and hearts on dancefloors.
Fellow champions of the techno scene, Jake Blood, Kangaroo Skull, Voitek and PWD join the fold and M5K brings the beats for this hometown throwdown.

item.title: Live Music Safari Kitchens
item.description:
For Live Music Safari, fourteen of Melbourne's much-loved and iconic live music venues open their doors for a wild night of free gigs and parties, and, for the first time, some are offering food as well.
Try the black angus, kangaroo or saganaki burgers or a spicy quesadilla at 1000 £ Bend. Full menu
Snack on Boney's jalapeno donuts, chicken kofta or cashew and carrot bao buns or fill a bigger appetite with the beef brisket. Full menu
Gloria Swanston's Kitchen at Lounge makes mouth-watering American classics like philly-cheese steaks, Texan BBQ ribs and southern fried green tomato sliders. Full menu
Treat yourself to Thai flavours - perhaps a betel leaf salad with salmon or mushroom dumpling green curry - courtesy of Choo Choo's at The Toff in Town. Full menu
Girl with the Gris Gris serve home-style, Louisiana cooking with a Creole and Cajun menu at Ding Dong. MMW ticket holders can take advantage of their special Live Music Safari offer - an Abita beer and chicken and sausage gumbo for $15. Full menu
Ferdydurke top star-studded frankfurters like the Fred Savage (frank with tequila infused chunky salsa, jalapenos, cheese and sour cream) and nachos too. Full menu
Huxtaburger now have a pop-up kitchen at The John Curtin Hotel. From the Denise to the Sondra, select any one of their much-loved burgers. Full menu
The Kelvin Club plates up carbonara croquets, burgers and an extensive list of cheesy toasties. Full menu
Fancy Hank's BBQ Joint serves traditional American-style, slow-cooked BBQ at The Mercat. Full menu
Miss Katies Crab Shack at The Public Bar boasts a low country boil, fried chicken, burgers and more made using produce from QVM. Full menu

item.title: Boney presents
item.description:
Boney have assembled a slew of Melbourne's chief electronic acts for a Live Music Safari party that spans over two levels, spills into Magic Mountain next door and flows out to a laneway party in Westwood Place.
Upstairs at Boney, Nic Hamilton and This Thing artists Dylan Michél, Kane Ikin and Coup D'etat examine the synchronicity between the contemporary creation of music and video as sounds and visuals are manufactured, found, re-filmed, blurred, slowed-down, sped-up, spliced and reconstructed.
Microwave synth star Versaj (aka Kirkis) plays heartfelt boogie jams to Silentjay and Julien Love serenades with Latin tracks in the downstairs area.
At Magic Mountain, disco darlings Misty Nights facilitate the quest to euphoric, psychedelic disco mayhem. Fashioned by the dream team Danny Hotep and Simon Barrel, Misty Nights steer the most discerning dancefloor in Melbourne.
In the laneway, Edd Fisher and Simon TK of Wax'o Paradiso play with guest Jimmy Caution and support comes from dance crew The Fandroids. Sample the fruits of the concrete jungle as these artists conjure the depths of the Amazon with their impeccable taste in tropical rhythms for Live Music Safari.

item.title: Big Ideas Under the Dome: Elizabeth Broderick
item.description:
In this Big Ideas Under the Dome series lecture, Elizabeth Broderick, Australia's Sex Discrimination Commissioner, speaks on the status of gender equality in Australia. The 30-minute talk will be followed by Q&A with Jill Singer.
Elizabeth has acted as Sex Discrimination Commissioner since 2007, and was also the Commissioner responsible for Age Discrimination from 2007 to 2011. She has been a key advocate for Australia's national paid parental leave scheme and domestic violence reform, and is Global Co-Chair of the Women's Empowerment Principles Leadership Group, a joint initiative of the UN Global Compact and UN Women.

item.title: Guest Cellar Door at Barwite Vineyard
item.description:
Guest Cellar Door at Barwite Vineyard is an opportunity to sample and buy boutique wines of distinction from six local labels in a magnificent vineyard setting with live music by Ryan Daykin.
Special prices just for you and your Christmas table. Luncheon platters will also be available prepared by Ben Davies from the Culinarian. Come along and enjoy the day and bring your friends.
Bookings for lunch are recommended.

image.altText: Guest Cellar Door at Barwite Vineyard
Guest Cellar Door at Barwite Vineyard

item.title: Sports Boat and PWC Expo
item.description:
Just a two hour drive from Melbourne, Bonnie Doon, on the banks of Lake Eildon, is the new home of the Sports Boat and PWC Expo for 2014.
The two day event is a free event, to be held in conjunction with the Lake Eildon Festival. With boat displays both off, and on the water, this is your chance to really check out Australia's best sports boats from the ground up and then head out on the lake to see what they are like floating.
There will be professional wakeboard and waterski demos throughout the weekend world-champion coaching opportunities, boat license testing and plenty of entertainment for both young and old. The Bonnie Doon Hotel will be hosting the event, making meals, snacks, and refreshments, readily available to get your hands on throughout the weekend.
Keep an eye on their Facebook page for the latest.

item.title: British Heraldry of the Great War
item.description:
This lecture, largely illustrated with images from the records of the College of Arms, will discuss the representation of the Great War in the armorial bearings granted to various military and naval commanders, armament manufacturers and others. The arms will be set in the context of older English heraldic traditions. The heraldic consequences of George V's desire to sever his family's ties with Germany will also be discussed.
The lecture will be presented by David Vines White and be held in the Auditorium, Education Centre at the Shrine of Remembrance
The event is free but gold coin donation welcome.

image.altText: British Heraldry of the Great War
British Heraldry of the Great War

item.title: St Arnaud Family Fun Day
item.description:
Come along to the St Arnaud Family Fun Day, what will be a fantastic family fun day.
There will be face painting, temporary tattoos, jumping castle, ferret racing, jellybean count, gigantic bubbles, minute-to-win-it games, craft stand for kids, sausage sizzle and much, much more!

item.title: Southgate Cinema
item.description:
A new film program heralds the on-set of spring from September to November at Southgate Cinema, Melbourne's only silent cinema. A new season of the long-running and free Tuesday movie nights will be programmed until May 2015.
Already an attractive anomaly as a free deckchair cinema, Southgate Cinema now offers a unique 'Blue Class' experience with a movie menu delivered to your deckchair from next-door eatery Bluetrain, recently refurbished with a critically acclaimed new design.
Southgate cinephiles can devour gourmet pizzas and graze on an eclectic variety of tasting platters with selections including a Bollywood platter, soft shell taco platter and Chinese five spice chicken ribs as they sit back and watch films like The Book Thief, Tracks and The Hunger Games 2: Catching Fire, with headphones and audio kits.
In November, Southgate Cinema films celebrate the theme of freedom with Mandela: Long Walk to Freedom, 12 Years a Slave and Inside Llewlyn Davis programed along with acclaimed but selectively screened Australian film Around the Block, about an Aboriginal boy in Redfern torn between his unexpected love of acting and the disintegration of his family.
Celebrated by audiences and critics alike, Southgate Cinema is listed on Time Out Melbourne's Bucket List and as a Herald Sun Hidden Gem.
The full September-November Southgate Cinema program and Blue Class menu can be viewed online.
Surrounding the cinema is Southgate's diverse range of restaurants and bars, including newly opened Italian restaurant and wine bar ARTUSI, Bavarian bier hall Hophaus and Inuit and native North American inspired restaurant Amarok. A range of boutique retailers including vintage and fair trade fashion, designer homewares, art deco jewellery and antique art can also be found within the precinct.
This is a free event but bookings are required.

item.title: Wallan Relay for Life
item.description:
This unique event has been created to recognise and celebrate those who have overcome cancer or are undergoing treatment, as well as the people who care for them. It provides an opportunity to celebrate the memory of loved ones lost to cancer.
The event itself is organised by a dedicated team of community volunteers and encourages teams of 10-15 people to get together, fundraise and then participate in a relay-style walk or run, challenging them to stay on the track overnight!
You can stay for the whole event and camp out, enjoy a heap of fun activities and attend moving ceremonies which make the event so very special.
The town of Wallan is hosting on Saturday November 22nd commencing at 4pm and ending at 10am on Sunday 23rd of November on the second oval at Greenhills Reserve, Wallan.
If you would like to participate please register now!
We are always looking for volunteers and sponsors as well in any way, shape or form!

item.title: Remembering Black Saturday five years on
item.description:
The bushfires that ravaged Victoria on 7 February 2009 claimed the lives of 173 people and destroyed more than 2000 homes.
Five years on, Melbourne curator Liza Dale-Hallett and historian Robert Kenny reflect on Black Saturday and how the devastating event continues to shape their personal and professional lives at the State Library of Victoria.
Robert Kenny lost his home on that tragic day. When writing about his experiences in his 2013 book, Gardens of fire: an investigative memoir (UWAP), he wove his own story into a broader history of the relationship between settler Australians and fire.
Working closely with communities in the wake of the Black Saturday bushfires, Liza Dale-Hallett has led the development of the Victorian Bushfires Collection at Museum Victoria.
In this discussion, Liza and Robert consider the role of history and memory in the way we make sense of such traumatic events, and the role historians are playing in the recovery phase.

item.title: Thessaloniki & Melbourne Sister City Festival
item.description:
Thessaloniki Association's Annual Festival in the centre of Melbourne celebrates the 30 year sister city relationship between the two cities.
The Thessaloniki Association's Annual Festival in the heart of Melbourne is presented in co-operation with the Hellenic Australian Chamber of Commerce and Industry (HACCI). Attendees of the festival include the Mayor of Thessaloniki Mr G. Boutaris, the Lord Mayor of Melbourne Mr R. Doyle, and several MPs from Victoria and Thessaloniki.
There'll be plenty of Greek food, a food exhibition, performances, business delegations and lots of fun. Cooks from Greece will demonstrate their cooking skills and offer Greek food tasting. Businesses from Greece and Melbourne will present their wares. Plus there will be stalls, performers, dancers and musicians to entertain the crowds.
Program starting at 1pm to be distributed on the day, speeches at 4pm.

item.title: The People's Weather Report
item.description:
The deadline for audio reports has just been extended to 5 November.
Now more than ever, climate change is one of the most pressing issues facing our planet. It is easy to feel overwhelmed by the sheer magnitude and concerned by the polarizing conversation. The People’s Weather Report is a global response to the enormity of climate change from a very personal perspective: yours!
Arts House are seeking participants to take part in this global project. The People’s Weather Report is seeking 300 audio 'weather reports' from around the world. These audio weather reports will be edited together to form part of a sculptural sound installation created by eco designer Tanja Beer, and showcased during sustainability festival, Going Nowhere. Arts House partner ABC RN will also produce two one-hour packages for radio broadcast.
Do you have concerns about the climate? What is happening weather-wise in your part of the world? If you’d like to make a contribution by sharing your individual thoughts on weather and the climate, then you can.
The weather reports don’t have to be recorded on fancy audio equipment, you can simply use a smart phone – they just need to be in digital format, and 3-5 minutes each. Visit the website for technical instructions and the email address to send your submission.
Weather report submissions must close 5 November. Presented by Arts House.
Source: City of Melbourne What's On

item.title: Improve Your Public Speaking and Gain Confidence
item.description:
If you are interested in practising your presentation skills, clearly articulating ideas and improving your self-confidence, this workshop is for you.
Pushing the Envelope Toastmasters will help you nurture these skills by providing a supportive and friendly environment for you to develop and build your communication and leadership skills at your own pace. It is a diverse group with varied speaking skill levels and backgrounds. Meetings generally focus on three aspects of public speaking: prepared speeches, impromptu speaking, and giving speech evaluations.

item.title: RACV Energy Breakthrough - Maryborough
item.description:
The RACV Energy Breakthrough provides an opportunity for students, teachers, parents and local industry to work together to design and construct a vehicle, a machine or innovation in technology that will represent an energy breakthrough.
School groups work throughout the year to design, build and test vehicles or machines within detailed specifications. It requires a team effort and an across-the-curriculum approach. These groups then bring their vehicles and machines to Maryborough, Victoria in November, for a huge celebration in which they can demonstrate and trial them in action.
More than 5,000 student entrants converge on Maryborough, a further 3,000 will work as support crew and another 13,000 will be visitors to the event.
The Energy Expo is amongst the action of the RACV Energy Breakthrough and offers visitors and entrants the chance to relax and enjoy the festive atmosphere. The Energy Expo provides entertainment, fascinating energy efficient displays and opportunities for career advancement.

image.altText: The end of the HPV secondary race

item.title: Annual Strawberries & Cherries Weekend
item.description:
The Bacchus Marsh Strawberries & Cherries Weekend takes place during November each year. Join in and celebrate the arrival of strawberry and cherry season along the magnificent Avenue of Honour and throughout Bacchus Marsh.
Fun activities for all the family including:
- Strawberry and Cherry trail. Experience the trail locations and have your trail passport stamped along the way to go into the draw for fantastic prizes. - Strawberry picking - Cherry pip spitting competition - Horse carriage rides (Sunday only) - Live music - Saturday night fireworks - Town centre entertainment - Strawberry and cherry inspired menus and many more family activities for everyone.
The full event program will be available on the website in late October or stay up to date with the latest news on the Facebook page, Visit Bacchus Marsh.

item.title: Markit@FedSquare
item.description:
For one day, the light-filled Atrium and Deakin Edge Theatre at Federation Square will be home to approximately 100 of Australia's most coveted independent designers and illustrators.
This is a curated market featuring independent designers selling their products which range from ceramics to homewares, jewellery, fashion accessories, stationery and prints.
Created by designers as a unique retail platform for independent design, Markit@FedSquare provides an opportunity for the public to speak directly with the creator, talk with them about their designs and purchase something beautiful.
The market is held under cover inside the Atrium and Deakin Edge Theatre at Federation Square. Admission is free!
Visit the website for a full list of designers.
